page.title: 13Recent Norton street names
page.content: Several of Norton's streets have been named by using the surnames of some past incumbents of Bartholomew's Church.Meare Close,after Thomas Meare Meare who was an incumbent between 1533- 1561 and later Hugh Meare from 1599-1604. Clement Place-after William Clement,an incumbent from 1596-1598. Keene Close, after Timothy Keene,the incumbent from 1733-1759.Middleton Close was named after Thomas Middleton incumbent from 1769-1776. After 1776 those in ecclesiastical office are referred to as rectors. Anderson Place was named after John Anderson, rector from 1854-1877. Fearon Green after Thomas Henry Browne Fearon, rector from 1877-1896.Kingston Place after Edwin James Bromley Kingston, rector from 1896- 1911, and Hamlett Place was named after George Hamlett, also rector of Norton church.
